meanings.definition: Relating to a consistory or council.
meanings.sent1: The consistorial decision was made after much discussion.
meanings.sent2: The consistorial meeting was held to address important church matters.
meanings.sent3: The consistorial gathering turned into a lively debate about the church's future.
meanings.sent4: Her consistorial authority in the council was unquestioned.
meanings.sent5: The consistorial chamber echoed with the voices of the council members.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a church council or assembly.
meanings.sent1: The consistorial delegates gathered for the annual church assembly.
meanings.sent2: The consistorial decisions were binding for the entire church council.
meanings.sent3: The consistorial assembly ended with a joyful hymn sung by all.
meanings.sent4: His consistorial leadership guided the church council through difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The consistorial hall was filled with the murmurs of the assembly members.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to a church tribunal or court.
meanings.sent1: The consistorial judgment was fair and just.
meanings.sent2: The consistorial court handled cases of church discipline.
meanings.sent3: The consistorial tribunal listened to the amusing testimony of the accused.
meanings.sent4: Her consistorial verdict brought closure to the church dispute.
meanings.sent5: The consistorial courtroom was solemn as the trial began.
